text: Ah Rona. If she only had Gonti’s wording I’d be at least ok with her.
Spoilers should start rolling in today right?
I know we’ve only seen a handful of cards so far but I’ve got a weird low-power vibe so far. There’s probably not enough spoiled to come to that conclusion though, but it’s nagging at me
I totally forgot it was already the 10th...man
The laziness of that Boros mechanic is also bugging me
MaRo is hyped about how it actually plays vs. reads.
I mean...it's just a tweaked Bolster, so not sure why it would play any differently.
Boros has generally been decent in Rav standard so if the guild has Legionaire/that Minotaur whose name escapes me type dudes anything is probably easy to make look good
Plus just because a mechanic seems clever and interesting in paper doesn’t mean anything ie cipher
A mechanic can be boring but effective with strong cards surrounding it. and interesting and weak if it’s held back so who knows how it’ll play out.
I'm curious if they push Mentor at all on a legendary creature (say Mentor 3) or even add it to combat tricks.

Mentor won’t be on a combat trick since it’s an attack trigger.
I get where Maro is coming from though. It offers options for the combat and it probably plays well in 60 card formats, but it just happens to be a mechanic that won’t scale as well to EDH.
I’d bet that well get a card that gives every creature Mentor.
Like giving all creatures exploit, which scales if you have the mana.
Exactly. Pontiff of Blight was a fun card
Giving all creatures mentor could be very powerful in a swarm.
Agreed. Although it won’t be as powerful as it seems.
I’ve been saying it since they spoiled it, but Mentor is going to cause a few minor headaches in multiples.
Why wouldn’t it be as powerful?
Let’s say you have a board of 4 2/2s and 4 1/1s. Even if they all have Mentor, your board maxes out as a mass of 2/2s without outside power buffing. That’s all I’m getting at.
It’ll still be powerful, but there are some limits.
You target as you attack so you can load them up on a single 1/1.
Or divide them, etc.
Your target has to be legal as you target and during resolution, so you can’t stack them all on a single creature.
Where does it say that?
That’s how targeting has always worked.
That makes it not only less good but a terrible mechanic because it can’t scale.
Wizards mentions it during their mechanic spotlight video.
That’s just terrible.
So it’s a limited mechanic.

Non-Commander rather than limited, but ya.
You can still stack, but you need asymmetrical power across the field.
So how does this work with Zada, the Hedron Grinder? Does it also copy when I do not discard?
we have a <#C8EPHVB40|spoilers> channel for this stuff because some people don't like seeing spoilers
It was more for movie spoilers but people adopted it for cards but sure. I think asking a question about the cards functioning is fine ol here.
lots of new people lately
I think spoilers was also used for leaks, but is now for all spoilers.
<@UCC4286P8> I’m not really sure because it’s a reflexive trigger.
Yeah, I’m wondering about that too mason
It still targets one creature....
[[zada, hedron]]

attachments.fallback: Zada, Hedron Grinder {3}{R} // Legendary Creature — Goblin Ally // Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell that targets only Zada, Hedron Grinder, copy that spell for each other creature you control that the spell could target. Each copy targets a different one of those creatures. // 3/3
attachments.text:
Legendary Creature — Goblin Ally
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell that targets only Zada, Hedron Grinder, copy that spell for each other creature you control that the spell could target. Each copy targets a different one of those creatures.
_"A hedron holds magic for a thousand years—or less, if need be."_
*3/3*
attachments.title: Zada, Hedron Grinder {3}{R}

text: Man that’s weird
I’m going to lean “no” you can’t copy it as the damage is created by a reflexive triggered abilities.
Not at all or just no when discarding?
Yeah, my buddy is a huge rules lawyer type and says it isn’t a spell that targets but the trigger targeting
So the answer is that it doesn’t copy
That makes sense.
Alas

<https://magic.wizards.com/en/articles/archive/making-magic/guild-order-part-1-2018-09-10>

Not sure how many of you all read these, but this is a really interesting look at how everything comes together for Guilds/Allegiance. There’s a few story bits and a few mechanical design hints for next set as well.

attachments.title: Guild to Order, Part 1
attachments.text: Mark previews a brand-new Guilds of Ravnica card and takes you behind the scenes of the set's creation!
attachments.fallback: MAGIC: THE GATHERING: Guild to Order, Part 1

text: I think the biggest reveal is that there are going to be 5 guilds that fall under Bolas’ influence, each headed by a Planeswalker.
so are we getting two legends of each guild
It didn’t say in that article.
i saw someone make a comment that were getting paruns/champions?
We’ve always got both in the past, 20 spread across three sets
It doesn’t seem unreasonable we’lol get that across two here but I don’t think it’s been confirmed

Guild Leaders* not Paruns. I apologize for being pedantic.

I don’t think it’s been confirmed either. With 5 Planeswalkers as heads of the guilds it would need to shift things around to the 3rd set.
We already have two GB mythics, and I’d be shocked if we got a third for this set.

I really hope they don’t just push off the mythic legends for the PWers.
do we have five confirmed planeswalkers heading the guilds?
Who is the sword for then if not the paruns
i only know of ral and vraska. i guess tezz too

The article confirmed each of the five Bolas-aligned Guilds will be headed by a Planeswalker.

Dovin Baan seems like an easy fit for Azorius with Isperia turned to stone.
After that you have to split it 50/50 between the Orzhov, Simic, Rakdos, and Gruul.
how did isperia turn to stone?
vraska?
yuppers
fun
Oh wow, so it's legit Bolas Guilds vs. Non Bolas Guilds?
how does bolas control selesnya
It’s in the article I linked above. There’s a few more details about it there.
oh
ive been so busy i havent caught up with the nicol bolas vs ugin story
i need to do that

He doesn’t.
The split is 2/3 for Guilds/Allegiance since we know there are only two walkers in Guilds.
Sweet. I haven't had time to read the story, I just got on my computer a few minutes ago
Guilds apparently takes place during the events of Ixalan/Dominaria. So Isperia dying is likely one of the last things to happen in the story.
ok

Yea, I have no clue who the guilds aligned with Bolas will be in Allegiance.
My guess is Simic and Gruul because their leaders seem more disposable than Rakdos or the Ghost Council (sorry Borborygmos.)
